snippet: The United States Anti-Doping Agency initiated a procedure against Lance Armstrong with a time frame for allegations that began in the 1990s and continued through 2010.
abstract: United States Anti-Doping Agency is set to bring doping charges against Lance Armstrong that could lead to him being stripped of his seven Tour de France titles; Armstrong calls the charges 'a witch hunt,' the same words he has used in the past when fighting off doping allegations; agency does not have the power to bring criminal charges but can strip him of the accolades that helped make him a celebrity.
lead_paragraph: The United States Anti-Doping Agency initiated a procedure against Lance Armstrong with a time frame for allegations that began in the 1990s and continued through 2010.

headline.seo: Lance Armstrong Faces New Doping Charges
